intro: Hybanthus urbanianus, commonly known as the urbanian hybanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly rough texture. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
